title: Augusta County: Mary Anna Sibert to David H. Evans, October 7, 1867
summary: Sibert confesses that she has sinned by thinking of Evans more frequently than she has thought of God. She writes that her most earnest prayer is that God will moderate her affections but closes the letter by urging Evans to pay her a visit as soon as possible.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Family, Women, American Civil War
